It was clean, in a great location, and our host was very communicative and friendly! I would definitely come back and recommend it to others!', 'Great stay and a really great host! Very responsive and flexible! Would stay here again!', 'Jodi was so easy to communicate with and so helpful, providing us with tons of local recs. The place was clean and beautiful, with snacks and toiletries in case we forgot anything. Nice area, easy to get around Williamsburg with lots of restaurants and shops around. Loved it!', 'Incredible apartment with everything you can wish for! Fresh, clean and big - both to cook but also to have a cozy evening at home. The area is safe and close to everything, boat path over to Manhattan and bike to Greenpoint or other parts of Brooklyn. Jodi was very communicative and gave us clear instructions before check-in, as well as checking with us in the meantime how we were doing. Would really recommend to anyone!', "I really enjoyed my stay at Jodi's place.
Convenient location and great space.
Jodi was super helpful and responsive, and quickly helped when the main key broke. She sent a replacement promptly.
I'd definitely love to stay at her place again!", 'Nice and cozy place with bus and metro access nearby and also a deli right outside. Everything was very accessible.', 'The place was perfect, I was a very nice neighborhood and a great place to visit brooklyn and manhattan.
Jody was always available', 'The neighborhood is very socially interesting, with a big difference between South and North Williamsburg. I was very interested! The apartment is very nice, neat in the details and welcoming. Accurate and punctual info.', 'Great apartment, well located and very good communication with the Jody!', 'I will absolutely be staying at Jodi‚Äôs again. Highly recommend! Cozy and great high ceilings. Even thoughtful water bowl for my dog. The one thing to keep in mind is that it is a bit of a walk to the nearest subway into Manhattan, but very doable.', "Fully-equipped and stylish appartment in the comparatively quiet Williamsburg area. What makes the place special is
1) All the details (e.g. deco and beauty articles, coffee, tea, ...) that made us feel at home from the moment we arrived
2) communication with Jodi, who - although we didn't meet her personally - provided us with so much information and support", 'would 100% stay here again
Clean place everything you need
lots of things to do around the area
wonderful host', 'Jodi was an exemplary host during my stay in Williamsburg. Not only was the place wonderful and convenient, as described, but the thought and detail Jodi has put into making the guest experience as frictionless as possible is the best I‚Äôve experienced across all of my Airbnb bookings. Would definitely book again!', "We enjoyed our stay at Jodi's and felt at home from the moment we arrived; it felt cosy but with plenty of space to plan, lounge, eat and sleep. We appreciated the elevator in particular, and I liked the apartment's high ceilings. Little things like good water pressure for the shower and easy to reach USB sockets made our stay very comfortable. The neighbourhood wasn't rowdy at night so we slept well, and the ferry was an excellent way of getting around. It's only a short walk away and it's quick and clean with amazing views.
Jodi was lovely; so helpful, responsive and attentive with some good recommendations for things to do and places to eat. We would definitely consider staying there again if we could.", 'Excellent location, excellent apartment, excellent hosting. No notes.']

title: West village unique artistic townhouse apt
all_reviews:
["Beautiful apartment in a magical location. We loved the neighbourhood and Victoria's place was a perfect, stylish oasis to return to. Air conditioned was excellent and much needed. Victoria was very welcoming.", 'This apartment is great if you want that bohemian feel. It‚Äôs spacious with a separate living room area that can be closed off if you want. I did hear some yelling in the hallway one night, but Victoria was quickie to assure me it was just her friend. There are 2 mini split AC‚Äôs, which kept it nice & cool. Great shower, mini fridge & Keurig in the room. I wouldn‚Äôt think you‚Äôd want to go down the steep staircase to cook, just eat out. My only issue was there was a lot of dust & grit around the bed frame‚Ä¶.but I‚Äôm a neat freak,', 'If you love the west village, this is a great location just one block off of Hudson St with all its eateries. The bedroom is in the back, which allowed us to sleep peacefully. My husband and I were visiting for our 11 year anniversary - the first trip without our daughter in 7 years - so we were ecstatic to get away to a comfortable place. I‚Äôve been renting places on Airbnb for over 10 years and have hosted myself for two different properties, and believe I can offer a fair assessment.
Pros: the owner let us check in early (so appreciated); owner is friendly and greets you upon arrival (could also be a con for introverts); comfortable queen bed and linens; spacious for NYC standards; not on a very busy street. Very clean; shampoos and body wash provided (so nice to not have to pack this);
Very interesting art work and sculpture throughout the space gave it personality and we enjoyed this aspect.
Drawbacks: beautiful outdoor backyard space not regularly accessible to renters (untapped potential here); shared kitchen (though ‚Äúshared,‚Äù does not feel open to you as there is a tenant on first floor); lack of privacy - we could easily hear conversations in the hallway (3 floors) so we realized that we could also be heard, especially since there are 3 doors exiting from the suite to the hallway. Due to the shared kitchen situation and a sense that it would be awkward to be there, we were grateful for the mini-fridge and microwave provided in the suite. We didn‚Äôt tackle the espresso machine (no instructions) and would have appreciated a simple coffee maker instead.
Side note: My experience of a ‚ÄúSuperhost‚Äù has changed over the recent years. It used to just be responsive communication and a clean, well thought out comfortable space. Today‚Äôs superhost demonstrates exemplary hosting -‚Äògoing above and beyond. For example, our last host in New Mexico left a welcome basket with a bottle of wine, homemade dog treats from a local bakery (we had our dogs with us), and fresh baked cookies (and it wasn‚Äôt even our anniversary!). She communicated ahead of time to see if we had any allergies before leaving these treats. Labels for light switches and remotes were there so we didn‚Äôt have to speculate or require the host to explain in person. None of this was expected, but so appreciated. That is the new ‚Äúsuperhost.‚Äù
Victoria‚Äôa hosting is more yesteryear - good enough (which is very good), but not exemplary.', "A superb and artsy location in the west Village, especially if you're planning to dine out on most occasions (there is a shared kitchen, but it's on a different floor--the apartment itself has a microwave, mini-fridge, and Nespresso machine). Communication with Victoria was always quick and easy, and if you're new to the city she's happy to give recommendations about what to do and how to get about.", 'Oh, where do I begin?! We absolutely loved the vibe of Victoria‚Äôs place‚Ä¶.. so artistically decorated and details throughout to make her guests comfortable. Walk to yummies in minutes. Location, perfect. Beautiful sunlight through the trees in the morning, yes trees. Peaceful block‚Ä¶ thank you Victoria!!!', "My friend and I stayed for a week at Victoria's wonderful apartment - it was just perfect for our first trip to New York - By far the best AirBnB experience I've ever had!
Victoria was prompt to respond to all of our queries before, and during the trip - including emergency dental recommendations!! She was the best first New Yorker interaction we could have asked for, and took care to introduce us to the apartment and the local area. She allowed us to drop our bags off early and pick them up later to check in/out which was a huge help. Victoria is generally just a gem and well deserving of her Superhost title.
The apartment was super clean and had everything we needed - the Nespresso machine was a very welcome touch! It is well decorated with original features, gorgeous art and sculpture and we loved that the building and artwork had a family history. The area is quieter at night than we expected but close enough to everything lively that we were looking for in the evenings, so we were always well rested in the comfy beds.
The location is absolutely perfect! Easy to walk to various districts, restaurants and bars are just a block over, you're close to the river and the High Line, and you really feel like you're in the middle of it all.
Couldn't have asked for anything more really and absolutely can't fault it. Just the perfect base for our unforgettable holiday! Thank you Victoria! XX", "A slice of heaven in the West Village!!! OUTSTANDING location, beautiful, artistic,clean, charming, safe, quiet, comfortable; just THE PERFECT PLACE!!! Thank you Victoria! Can't wait til my next visit!!!", 'Beautiful spacious apartment, very good value and Victoria was a brilliant and very responsive host. The place was extremely clean and matched the description perfectly, we throughly enjoyed our stay here!', 'always love staying here... thanks Victoria!', 'My daughter and I absolutely loved the place. Really big, artistic, homey and quirky in the best way. It‚Äôs in the heart of the West Village close to fabulous restaurants and a vibrant nightlife all within a very short walking distance. It has to be one of the quietest locations as well. I would absolutely recommend this place.', 'Victoria was an extremely gracious host. She had an extensive list of restaurant recommendations and the space made us feel right at home.', "Style, history and location - You'll find it here. A west village address that's very walkable. A historic neighborhood with activity and style. Stay here, you'll be glad you did.
Victoria is a true New Yorker and a superior host. She's very responsive and friendly. We met her in person.
I definitely would stay here again.", 'Victoria‚Äôs place was a perfect place to come back to each evening. Away from the hustle and bustle, on a quiet street. It was lovely and will most definitely stay again.', 'We were warmly welcomed by Victoria and given a brief explanation of the accommodation. The flat is spacious, light and cosy and is decorated with taste. The bathroom is neat, with clean towels and various amenities (shampoo, shower gel, ...). Two good air conditioning systems.
Located in a quiet, safe neighborhood, within walking distance of the Hudson River. Many pleasant restaurants and cafes in the neighborhood. Also food stores within walking distance. We have always slept very well there, it is quiet. Ideal base to visit NY, lots of public transport within walking distance.
The hostess is nearby but respects your privacy.
We will definitely come back for a next visit to NYC!', 'I wish I could stay here forever! Most amazing apartment with the best art and such a unique West Village local feel. Victoria could not be more amiable and welcoming, we felt right at home and cannot overstate the beauty of the space. Thanks for a great stay, we hope to be back soon!', "Victoria's place was great! Very cool location and great communication. Thank you for hosting us!", 'Roomy place in a great location!', 'Perfect place to stay in nyc for a couple! Amazing location, clean and comfortable.', "We had a great stay! The apartment was spacious and had all of the essentials for a comfortable stay. It was located in a walkable neighborhood. Victoria was responsive and very accommodating during our visit. We would love to stay again when we're visiting NY.", 'Great stay, very comfortable! Would stay again.', 'A wonderful apartment nestled in Greenwich Village. Victoria‚Äôs place was the perfect spot for us to explore New York City for a few days. The communication was excellent and we loved the apartment, it felt like home for the time we were there. Would highly recommend!', 'Fantastic, walkable, charming West Village location could not have been better. We found plenty of local spots for meals, coffee, and groceries. The subway was about an 8-10 minute walk that felt like half that, because the scenery was so nice. We had an easy time getting to all the various places we wanted to go. Victoria was friendly, responsive, and happy to share the vey interesting history of her 1800s building. The best parts about the rooms: high ceilings, beautiful sculptures and paintings, original moldings, natural light from tall windows, clean linens, plush towels, comfortable pillows. The only knocks: the semi-opaque window shades let in a fair amount of night light from surrounding buildings, there was a strong smell of Marijuana one night, and there is a narrow flight of stairs to navigate with luggage that could be difficult for some. Overall we loved our stay, and it will be our first choice if we return.', 'Stylish apartment in a hip area of Manhattan. Victoria was fantastic, we would happily return!', "My daughter and I travelled to NYC to celebrate her birthday and we spent a wonderful time at Victoria's home. Everything is in offer - high quality bedding, luxurious towels etc. It is such a bonus to have a whole floor - much more space than a hotel and more comfortable. Loved the art work which reflects the eclectic nature of The Village. The location is so central - what a bonus! A short distance to central subway lines. We did a tour of the neighbourhood which enabled me to appreciate The Village even more. If you have time, catch a show at the Cherry Lane Theatre. And John's Pizza on Bleecker Street is outstanding... Thank you so much Victoria for providing a restful, safe, haven. We will be back, soon I hope!", 'Friendly, accommodating host and a beautiful apartment with a brilliant collection of books and artwork. The area is quiet when you need it to be with some great spots for breakfast and a short walk to the Whitney, the High-line and a range of transport options to get up or down town quickly. Will definitely aim to stay again when next in the city.', 'I highly recommend Victoria‚Äôs place! She was very responsive and flexible. The space was very cool and art-filled. Bed so comfy. The location was absolutely perfect. Quiet. Look forward to next time!', 'An absolute gem! We loved it and we‚Äôll definitely be back!', 'Beautiful apartment in the heart of Greenwich
Very private, quiet, beautifully decorated and Victoria is an amazing host!
We will come back!', "As a first-timer in NYC with my teenaged daughter, I felt safe and cared for at Victoria's. Perfect location, great food very close by, and so much to do in the Village. Close to subway. Easy from Laguardia. Would definitely stay here again.", 'Fantastic apartment in the perfect West Village location. Highly recommend and look forward to returning!', 'Lovely apartment, very authentic West Village experience, excellent location, quiet street.', 'One of my very favorite places to stay...ANYWHERE!...thanks Victoria!', 'This is my second time staying at Victoria‚Äôs beautiful apartment in West Village. It‚Äôs in a brilliant location, lots of great cafes and restaurants nearby. Easy to access the subway to other parts of NY. Victoria was very welcoming as always. Can‚Äôt wait to come back and stay again one day!', 'Beautiful apartment, large, clean and comfortable. Loved the historic character of the building. Great decor and artwork throughout. Very nice big bathroom for New York City. Nice and quiet at night. Air conditioning was working great - even during the heatwave. Easy, accommodating check in/check out. Lovely west village location. I would definitely stay there again.', "Victoria's place was great! She was really accommodating with storing bags before and after, and is easy to contact with any questions.", 'great experience!! place was so cute and clean.', 'We loved our stay at Victoria‚Äôs. It is a roomy, quaint &charming space with high ceilings. The west village location is prefect for walking and we found it very safe and quiet at night. Victoria is a very thoughtful host. We highly recommend and hope to return!', 'Victorias place was great. She was great with communication accommodation !', 'This is a such a fun place to stay. The hostess is warm and inviting, the house is rich with history and art and the guest level is well appointed. The neighborhood is incredibly convenient and full of so great places to explore. This AirBNB will be saved in my favorites.', 'A wonderful and peaceful space.', 'Great location in a very interesting & charming neighborhood. Victoria went out of her way to accommodate our needs.', 'Victoria‚Äôs apartment was beautiful. The location was perfect. And Victoria was an extremely gracious host. We loved our stay!', 'Victoria‚Äôs place was perfect for us. It was in a great location. Close to the subway stops and lots of great restaurants and bars .
The street was quiet, and the apartment itself was a lot bigger than we were expecting. Even the bathroom was spacious!
The apartment was really nicely decorated, very clean and well laid out.
We found absolutely nothing wrong with the apartment. It was just perfect.
Highly recommend this place. Victoria was an awesome host! Easy check in and checkout as well.', 'always love staying here...the best of NYC right outside your door...thanks Victoria for another wonderful stay...', 'Prime walkable location if you‚Äôre looking to hang in the area. Absolutely loved it. The space was filled with creative energy and Victoria made us feel right at home. Would definitely stay again if visiting the Manhattan area.', 'Wonderful apartment, wonderful host, wonderful stay. Charming walk up with interesting sculptures and original architectural features. (Natural) light flooded space throughout. Everything clean, comfortable and convenient. Victoria was easy to communicate with and so responsive to queries. She went out of her way to let us get our luggage inside quite early on arrival and was prepared to do the same on departure had we needed it. Thoroughly friendly and accommodating. I have never stayed anywhere quieter in the city. I heard not so much as a footfall from either below or above the entire stay any time day or night. Many thanks to our gracious host, Victoria--M&K', 'Charming apartment in the west village, spacious and comfortable. The area is quiet, but close to bars and restaurants. Very well served area by public transit. Victoria is kind and available. We hope to go back!', 'Went to Victoria‚Äôs place with my best friend. Place suited our needs perfectly with a separate bed for each of us to sleep in and fantastic location in West Village. Victoria was really responsive and very friendly. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre going with a friend or two for a weekend NYC trip.', "Victoria's lovely West Village home is the perfect spot for enjoying the best of New York City. It's comfortable, homey and impeccable with all the amenities.", "If you love high ceilings, elaborate moldings, chandeliers, hardwood floors, great art, books and sculpture then you have found it in Victoria's stylish and spacious apartment. Add a perfect location to the mix and you have found the best accommodation in the West Village!", 'Great space, host, location and communication. Will definitely book again!!', 'Amazing place, in an amazing part of town. Ideally positioned to explore NYC! Would highly recommend!', 'I love staying at Victoria‚Äôs - I sleep so well & really enjoy everything about the space & the neighbourhood. Can‚Äôt wait for next time!', 'perfect, quiet location in West Village. Ideal. Everything was good. We loved it. Victoria was very responsive.', 'Victoria was lovely ‚Äî as was her place! Great space and great neighbourhood! Thank you, Victoria!', "Victoria has a beautiful property, a classic New York brownstone. We spent four nights there. It is spacious and comfortable and met our needs very well. We now live in Europe and used her place as a base for our visit in our former hometown. The neighbourhood is vibrant and alive, better than ever. It's quiet and a bit out of the way - an asset - but well connected to Manhattan and all it has to offer. We would recommend this as a perfect place to stay when you come to New York City.", "Victoria's place is real treasure if you're visiting NYC and want to stay away from the touristy center. Located in the very heart of the West Village, one of the very best walking locations in the city. Very quiet (unusual in the city) and overlooks a lovely garden space in the back. The furnishings have a hipster/punk vibe - the opposite of plain vanilla, but without sacrificing comfort. Victoria was always available and responsive.", 'Real JEWEL in a very heart of Greenwich Village! Amazing place- high ceilings, you will be surrounded by sculptures and oil paintings and a good selection of art books.
This house has a garden, so by waking up you always see the green (at least in the summer).
Despite the fact that the apartment is in the midtown, it‚Äôs very calm. The area is worth to spend more time in - best restaurants and cafes are all nearby!', 'We loved this area and Victoria‚Äôs place is old and full of character. Owned by her parents from 1956 - they were part of the local arts community then, as is Victoria now.
The space is large with very high ceilings and with plenty of room to spread out.
The adjacent Hudson St is packed with cafes, restaurants and bars, but Greenwich Street itself is quiet and restful. Our favourite small chain of coffee shops has an outlet just a few minutes away (‚Äò787‚Äô - try their whiskey-flavoured coffee either hot or cold!). Just 10mins walk away is Chelsea Market (we loved Amy‚Äôs Bread), the High Line and the Whitney. 20 mins away. Just off Bleecker St, is Arturo‚Äôs Pizza. Great piano jazz every night in the bar area (reasonable prices and best to book Fri-Sun if you want the bar area). Bryant Park is just a 30 minute walk away, and the 9/11 memorial at the start (or end) of Greenwich St.
Really nothing to dislike about our stay at Victoria‚Äôs and we hope to be back in the very near future!!!', 'Absolutely beautiful!! Can not say enough great things about this place! The location is quiet and charming- restaurants and stores nearby. Walkable to so many great sights. The apartment itself is spacious and clean - full of cool art. Just a dream! Highly recommend!!', 'Victoria is a wonderful host, very attentive and always available when needed. The apartment is very charming and very well located with close access to one of the best subway lines. It will be my new address in NYC and I highly recommend it to everyone', 'Could not have had a better experience. Victoria does a great job, great location, and plenty of space compared to the typical room.', 'What a great place to stay! Awesome location with all sorts of amenities close by. Beautiful building with v cool ambience - street noise minimal - we had window open the whole time. Powerful aircon. Microwave and fridge and some eating tools and glasses in apartment and access to kitchen if needed. Super comfortable beds. Great shower. All comforts - lots of soft towels, soft bed sheets, hairdryer, toiletries, Lindt chocolates, water. Couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better intro to NYC. Victoria happy to answer questions but totally unobtrusive, too.', 'This is the best place I‚Äôve stayed in NYC. It‚Äôs larger than the photos let on, the location is quiet and very walkable, and the host is friendly and responsive. I‚Äôd stay here again in a heartbeat.', 'We LOVED staying at Victoria‚Äôs place!!! It was very comfortable & accommodating. The sofa bed was very sleepable‚Ä¶.high quality! Good shower with rain shower head. Great place! Awesome location!! Some nice touches that were really appreciated:
- brand new shower puff for our use
- quality shampoo/conditioner & body wash
- bowl of Lindt truffles!
- coffee pods
- water bottles in refrigerator
- LOTS of hangers in the closet
These little things are of small expense, but really improve the experience. Thank you!', 'It is perfect. Charming ambience, great art work, the best neighborhood, kitchen is well equipped. We had a wonderful time & felt very much at home. We highly recommend a visit with Victoria.', 'Very nice comfy apartment, more spacey than the photos suggest, high ceilings, great to unwind after a day of walkting & visiting. Excellent location, safe and rather quiet, 5-10 minutes walk to subway stations, convenient bus stop to reach LES and East Village, lots of restaurants and caf√®s nearby, Meatpacking district literally down the street. Victoria was a very responsive yet unobstrusive host. We can totally recommend to stay there.', 'Wonderful bedding, great art and books! Must stay in Greenwich village!', "We had a wonderful time at Victoria's place, and I would definitely return. Lots of room, very cute, clean and nicely decorated apartment in the midst of Greenwich Village. Just steps out into the street. Easy pick up for taxi and Uber. And Victoria was always there for any questions. We felt fortunate to have found her place and that her flat was available.", "This is our new favorite place to stay in New York. The townhome exudes all the charm and history of Greenwich Village with a Euro vibe and high tech amenities. Victoria's personal touches and family art make the suite even more welcoming. This is a gem of a place.", 'Victoria was very friendly and so accommodating she let us check in a bit early since we had an early flight , really appreciate it !', 'We had a great time!', "Best airbnb I've stayed in in NYC. Updated 1840 townhouse in West Village Historical District. Rental had 2 rooms w/ high ceilings, lots of art on the walls and sculpture on the side. Also pair of tall french doors overlooking the back garden. Very quiet too. Location was a few blocks from several of the best takeout food in NYC and excellent restaurants and bars. Also a few blocks from the river park. Walkable to Whitney Museum and Chelsea art galleries. I want to come back", 'This place has the most incredible location. It‚Äôs near many wonderful restaurants and great places to walk. The apartment was very clean and comfortable. Victoria was great with communication and we enjoyed visiting with her. We plan to visit again the next time we are in New York.', 'I will be back to Victoria‚Äôs beautiful home in a fantastic location in the beautiful West village. Spotless, well appointed and decorated place to stay while enjoying everything the city has to offer. Loved my stay.', 'We have stayed many times and expect to stay many more.', 'The place and location and host are all *FANTASTIC*. The area is too.', 'We had a fantastic second stay with Victoria. She is a warm and wonderful host , who makes you feel right at home. The space itself is cozy, quiet, well appointed, and within easy walking distance of the best the Village has to offer. We hope to make this our "home away from home" when staying in NYC moving forward.', 'Victoria is a wonderful host and the space was wonderful. I spent most of my time outside, but the space was a perfect way for me to decompress. Clean, comfortable and quiet. I could not ask for anything more.', 'We loved our stay at Victoria‚Äôs apartment! The neighborhood is so charming, of course, and very walkable. The apartment had everything we needed and was a nice place to rest between our activities. Her bath towels were the softest we‚Äôve ever felt - we made a note to buy the same brand for ourselves. We would definitely stay again!', 'This artist‚Äôs space was comfortable, full of light and original art, and so cozy. Victoria was a gracious and accommodating host, and made every effort to enhance our stay. Super clean, and fantastic neighborhood, easily walkable to restaurants and all the places we wanted to get to. Incredibly peaceful and safe neighborhood. Highly recommend!', "Real NYC neighborhood! Great location if you want to avoid tourists! Quiet at night.
Nice size bathroom, hot water, tall showerhead, big towels. Comfy bed. Great WiFi. One flight of stairs to your 2-room suite. Gracious hostess. We have already recommended Victoria's place to friends.", "Great single level flat in the West Village. It's wonderfully decorated and very spacious living room and bedroom that can be separated. The flat had a small refrigerator, coffee maker, and a microwave which is all we needed. Victoria was friendly and welcoming, and I would definitely stay here again!", 'LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION
VERY COMFORTABLE
NOT TOO MANY STAIRS - 2ND FLOOR JUST RIGHT
STREET NOT TOO NOISY BUT NO SOUNDS FROM STREET IN APT ANYWAY.
WE HOPE TO RETURN WHEN WE VISIT NY AGAIN.', 'Victoria ‚Äòs second floor apartment was large, comfortable and quiet. It is located in a lovely leafy neighbourhood . We were able to walk everywhere from this location. There are plenty of restaurants in the neighbourhood.
Victoria responded promptly to any queries.', 'Victorias Place is truly a breath of fresh air in New York. Incredible location in West Village with incredible taste in styling as well. If you appreciate art in the slightest you will fall in love with her place. Victoria is also the warmest host I‚Äôve had an encounter with through Airbnb.', 'Everything was great. We would stay again
What was surprising was the wonderful art that filled the walls', 'Wonderful. Victoria‚Äôs standards are high & she has amazing taste. She is also a so a wonderful human, I feel lucky to have found her Airbnb.', "Our stay at Victoria's was delightful. Our host was welcoming, helpful, gave us tons of advice ; the apartment is absolutely perfect, cosy, lots of room, we could have stayed here forever. And the area, of course, is more than nice, in the middle of West Village: a very quiet street a few meters away from thousands of restaurants, shops, hip coffee shops, and more. Couldn't have dreamt of a better place to stay in NYC.", 'This was my second time staying at Victoria‚Äôs place and it was fantastic again! It is a beautiful, bright and clean space. It is also very spacious and comfortable. The location can‚Äôt be beat‚Ä¶ I love that it is away from the tourist hub-bub and is part of a neighborhood. Victoria was great with communication and so accommodating! We had problems with our flight getting there and didn‚Äôt get to her place until quite late but she still waited up for us and greeted us! She was also very accommodating by letting us store our luggage until our flight left later on our last day. I would stay here again and again.', 'Great location for us. Victoria was very helpful and friendly. Perfect weekend.', "As a return visitor to Victoria's lovely home, I have nothing but high praise for her delightful West Village retreat. We are always thrilled to be back in this iconic neighborhood and Victoria's welcoming, gentle family setting makes us feel right at home. We hope to be back again soon!", 'I can‚Äôt rate Victoria‚Äôs place more highly. We couldn‚Äôt be happier we stayed in the village rather than the hustle of Times Square. Restaurants are everywhere and we always felt safe. A short walk or subway everywhere. Loved it!', "We can't say enough about our stay at Victoria's unit. The location in the heart of beautiful West Village is an urban explorer's paradise. The unit is surrounded by historic brownstones, and wonderful boutiques and restaurants. Every street and corner offers a new discovery. The unit is fantastic in every way; quiet and comfortable without the need for AC during warm days. The art and vintage books in the unit are exceptional, adding style and sophistication to the experience. Thank you Victoria, for a perfect stay.", "Location can't be beat--right near scores of restaurants and shops and yet on a fairly quiet street. Apartment is especially quiet at night. A moderate walk to the 1 subway line. Great place to get breakfast 2 blocks away opens at 8 every morning.", 'This is a superb apartment in a great location. We loved the location. Nice touches like the Nespresso machine and high quality toiletries. The mini fridge was helpful also. Victoria met us on arrival and gave thorough instructions on use of the apartment. Bed was comfortable and extra bath towels were provided.', 'We had a fantastic stay at Victoria‚Äôs place. It‚Äôs in a highly desirable location yet away from too much noise. Easily walkable to the West Village, Greenwich Village, East Village and so, so much more. Also minutes from the subway. The place is eclectically and beautifully decorated by someone with an artist‚Äôs touch. Highly recommended.', 'Great location', 'Victoria‚Äôs apartment is a gem in the West Village. We loved our stay.', "I spent 3 days at Victoria's in January. The rental space was large and uncluttered, with a comfortable bed and a large sitting room. The bedroom also had an electric kettle which I took full advantage of each morning so I could make my favorite teas in my pajamas when I woke up and again before I went to bed. I used the shared kitchen to prepare a week's worth of homecooked meals for my adult child who lives nearby. There were 3 fantastic grocers within easy walking distance [Brooklyn Fare, Dagostino and Gourmet Garage]. There were also many wonderful eating/drinking establishments in close vicinity. Check-in and checkout were a breeze. Victoria was very accessible and a wonderful hostess.", 'An absolute fantastic place to stay in NYC! The neighbourhood feels safe, there‚Äôs lots of restaurants and shops nearby, and close to transit. The unit is clean, comfortable, and fairly quiet for New York.
Victoria is so nice and quick to respond with any questions. She was so welcoming to us and flexible. We will certainly stay again should we return to New York.', 'Victoria was very proactive and easy to deal with. She consistently responded to messages quickly. The place looks just like the pictures. Lots of books to keep us busy when relaxing, or in for the night. Tree lined section of town with calm, residential feel. Apartment itself is comfortable and quiet. Slept well. Lots of excellent restaurants/bars nearby. Less than 10 minute walk to a couple of major subway lines. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.', "Upon arrival the host let me know she was sick and showed up to let me in with a mask on. I could hear her coughing consistently throughout my stay. I would have appreciated a heads up that she was sick and the option to book another place. Five days later I am now coughing. My guess is that she didn't do a good job cleaning the space given her health. The bathroom and floors were dirty. The bedding was definitely far below par. The duvet did not have a cover on it, the sheets were old and dingy and the pillows were old and uncomfortable. The residents of the townhouse could be heard throughout my stay although it was not excessive and didn't bother me too much. I didn't make any requests since the host was sick and I didn't want to be around her. Overall it was a disappointing stay however I loved the west village and will definitely stay there again next time I am in the city.", 'Book it! This is an amazingly beautiful, well appointed, clean apartment in the West Village. Many amazing restaurants nearby. It is also a convenient walk to subway stations. The host is gracious, thoughtful, and accommodating. I hope to have the opportunity to stay there again!']

title: Lovely Bedroom in Artist's Home
all_reviews: ['Staying with Lorelei & Alex was a lovely experience. It was our first time in a shared space with host, but with our bedroom and bathroom on a separate floor, our stay was very private. Having someone on-site for check- in was welcoming and reassuring, and the local recommendations were kind. Transit is close and easy to follow, and the neighborhood is walkable with lots to do. Enjoyed our stay very much!', 'Our stay with Alex and Lorelei was super. They were flexible and easily accessible when our flight was postponed. The room is very spacious and nice to have your own spacious bathroom. Recommended!', 'We had a great time in New York. The place is a very good place to explore New York. Public transport can be reached in a few minutes, cafes and restaurants nearby. And Alex and Lorelei have good tips and information. We felt very comfortable and can definitely recommend the accommodation', 'This place is unique because of the host and also because of the location. We had a great time, talked about stuff and felt like at home. The true spirit of airbnb idea.', 'We had a lovely stay here in Brooklyn. Very polite, and lovely hosts with a lovely home. We stayed for 10 days and felt very comfortable throughout. There is lots to do near by with some lovely coffee spots and restaurants near by. Thanks for letting us stay Alex, we had an absolute blast!', 'Alex and Lorelei are wonderful hosts and their space was a perfect basecamp for our NYC adventure - highly recommended !']

title: Chez Jesse Vacation Spot - Garden
all_reviews: ["Great accommodation! 10 minutes maximum of subway station! Bathroom was great, so was the room! The kitchen had everything it needed and still had complimentary coffee! What made the breakfast easier! I found the neighborhood quiet and I didn't have any problems! We return at 22:00 by subway and no problem! When it comes to value, I found it a great cost benefit. I recommend it to everyone.", 'Thank you, Jesse! Your home was just what we needed for a brief stay in NY. Good location, price, convenience, cleanliness and comfort. We drove in from Boston; easy to park on the street; made it possible to not need to drive all the way into the city. Clear directions both pre visit and in the resource book in the room for guests. Appreciated the thoughtfulness you put into the kitchen / living room area as well - comfortable, lovely and thoughtful.', 'Incredibly stay with Jesse! He was very communicative and the place was squeaky clean. The place has ample security & is close enough to public transit. Would definitely return to stay.', 'I went to New York on a solo trip from the beginning of my life.My stay is 7 days.I was worried that every place was expensive and I found a place to stay.The host will respond as soon as they ask questions.The toilet, bathroom is next to the room, so I can only use it myself.The living room is shared and fully equipped with a refrigerator, cups, coffee, and microwave.It wasn\'t very suitable for other guests, but when I met them, they said, "Hi!"The‚ò∫Ô∏è room was also spacious, and it was clean.There is also an iron, a lot of hangers, drawers, etc., so I think it is very suitable for long-term stays.The train is also close by.I used Uber to get around at the beginning of the day and when I came back at the end.There were not enough clothes on the way, so I checked the location with the host and went to the coin laundry alone in the morning. TheüòÇ supermarket and pharmacy were also within walking distance, so I went shopping, but there was no problem!I was very lonely and cried to say goodbye to the host when I left.It was a really cozy place to stay that felt like a home away from home.I\'ve decided here by looking at the ratings, but I know what you\'re saying.I think I will choose this place without hesitation if I come to New York again (o ^ ^ o) Thank you Erica & Jesse', "A fantastic stay with lots of room and an incredibly clean home. Location was great, with it being less than a 10 minute walk to the nearest subway which could get you to Times Square in under 30 minutes. Jesse was a great host who provided clear instructions prior to arrival and whenever we had to contact him during our stay (which was minimal as everything was spot on) he'd respond in a timely manner. Overall a brilliant stay and a place I'd recommend anyone to stay at.", 'Jesse was an amazing a patient host, instructions were clear and house rules were reasonable. Genuinely felt like a second home while in the city and would (and probably will lol) book again. Amazing quality especially for its price. Thank you again for everything.']

title: Room 2- Victorian Home to Enjoy
all_reviews:
['enjoyed the stay. Thanks.', 'Great spot! It‚Äôs so hard to find an awesome airbnb in NYC and here is totally ideal. Laura is awesome too; highly recommended!', 'I love staying at Laura‚Äôs! It‚Äôs a fascinating house in a great location. Easy entry, Comfortable beds, great bathroom and kitchen. It was the perfect oasis in between visits with family in Brooklyn.', 'I was not able to travel because of illness, but my mom (the other guest) stayed. She said it was a wonderful, clean and well-managed airbnb. Laura was great at communication and very helpful and nice. Thank you for everything and hope to stay with you on my next trip to New York!', "Felt like I was staying at a friend's house.", 'Pleasant stay, very nice and clean room. I recommend this place!', "Very good stay at Laura's, who was very welcoming!
Everything was perfect, we did not miss anything during these few days:)
Great location in Brooklyn, the Q line 5 min from the house took us everywhere!
We recommend eyes a second thought! Thank you so much Laura!", 'Pleasant stay with Laura, very kind host with good advice, who makes you feel at ease. Thanks, Elodie', "Laura's house was quite close to transport and shops.
The room was very clean and tidy and very quiet. I was at the back of her house so that may be why.
Although the bathroom was shared it was not a problem as I hardly ever saw the other guests.", 'Great location between 2 subway stops of the Q train. 2nd time here Will book again depending on availability.', "This was hands down one of the best airbnb stays I have experienced. The house is beautiful, full of character, clean and private. The airbnb room I staying on the top floor was an excellent place to sleep, read and put in a full day's work. It was a luxury to be able to comfortably use the kitchen and make coffee in the morning. The neighborhood is great - there are a number of restaurants and bakery's within a 5 minute walk. Laura herself was awesome, I'm glad I had a chance to meet her. She gave me a ride to Park Slope which saved me an Uber fare!! I want to move in.", "location:3 blocks from the Beverley Road Subway(Q line), 30 minutes you're in Manhattan..
house has a wonderful ambience, my room was on the third floor, with plenty of light streaming in, an immaculately clean bathroom next to it..
host Laura, a pleasant woman with a big smile, was very kind and attentive to any questions or concerns..
hope to stay here again soon..V", 'Laura was very friendly and gave us a great restaurant recommendation nearby. The location was perfect for us to get to a tournament at the Parade Ground.', 'Laura was very helpful and welcoming. She made my stay lovely. The place was clean and close to subway. I would definitely stay again.', 'Laura is very nice and the room was exactly what we were looking for. Also right on a frequent subway line and easy access to anywhere you need to go. Would definitely stay here again.', 'Laura has a beautiful home and is one of the friendliest hosts I have ever stayed with! The bedrooms are spacious, well appointed and comfy and the bathroom is very clean, large and easy to share.
As a single woman I felt very safe as Laura and her sweet pup Ash were almost always present in the living room when you first come in and she was available if there was ever anything I needed. Hopefully we can stay again!', 'Loved our stay at Laura‚Äôs house!! She was very friendly and answered all of our questions, bathroom and bedroom were clean and spacious. Would recommend!', 'Checks all the boxes. Quiet Victorian in a unique patch of Brooklyn, with a perfect shower and just a few minutes‚Äô walk from the Q to Manhattan. Double bedroom is an ideal stay for a solo traveler going to a show at the Kings Theatre. Laura is super sweet and has all sorts of interesting art and curios to explore over [complimentary] morning coffee or tea. Excellent Caribbean fast-casual eatery (Island Express) around the corner, too. Definitely would stay again!', 'I had a fantastic stay at Laura‚Äôs! I‚Äôd wholeheartedly recommend her place to anyone and I‚Äôd absolutely stay there again next time I‚Äôm in town :)', 'Laura is an attentive and friendly host who offers an amazingly quiet place to stay on a residential Brooklyn street with many nearby restaurants.', 'Laura really is a Super-Host! Highly recommendation to stay at her place if you want to explore both Manhattan and Brooklyn. Quiet place close to the Metro, Coffee-places, restaurants etc. Thanks for having me, Laura!', 'I highly recommend this accommodation. The welcome is very warm and the room is very clean. Great location to get to downtown NYC.
Happy hosting Laura and a thought for H your adorable dog.', 'Laura was a very nice and accommodating host! The house was beautiful and the room was very comfy and cozy. I would be happy to stay again if I am in the area!', 'The manual was self-explanatory and Laura was flexible when I wanted to check-in a little earlier than the specified time to leave my bags. The room itself was nice and cozy with all the amenities that you would need for a comfortable stay.', 'My stay was good, only difficulty was I had to drive there and find parking but it all worked out real well and my stay work out.', 'Wonderful place to stay and conveniently located to where I was going. The house is very cozy and Laura was very accommodating to my late hours coming and going. Ash, the dog, was very nice and loves the scratches', "(My review for Room 4 vanished! That's the room I stayed in for my whole visit ‚Äî I just rented Room 5 for half my stay so I could have the upstairs to myself. So I can't speak to Room 5; this is a rehash of my review for Room 4.)
Room 4 is as everyone says ‚Äî comfy, quiet, perfectly located for Kings Theatre, awesome bathroom and tub, and of course Laura's warm, welcoming hosting and her adorable dog. Thanks to you and your family for a great stay!", "similar to other reviews, it was great to stay at laura's!!
the room was big and quiet, ultra clean bathroom, laura is usually around and fun to chat with
very close to Q line, bodegas/coffee close for morning time, safe/friendly neighbourhood
I'd stay again if I'm back in NYC ... hopefully soon", 'Comfortable, accessible, unique home, with the host one always wishes for. The few rules about cleaning up after yourself in shared spaces are totally sensible. Lovely Airbnb in a private home that still gives you privacy, whilst having the benefit of a 25 yr resident of NYC/Brooklyn who is so helpful and kind. The best place ever! Don‚Äôt doubt this one. Snap it up!', "The four days I stayed at Laura's house was a time to see the warm home in Brooklyn. I could enjoy New York in a quiet and relaxed neighborhood, and it took me 30 minutes to get to the center of the city, so transportation was convenient. There is also a prospect park that comes out after walking for 15 minutes, so it was good to take a walk in the park in the morning. Thanks to you, I enjoyed my trip to New York. Thank you.", 'First of all‚Äî Laura‚Äôs house is gorgeous! The bathroom alone made me excited to stay there. Her place is super close to the train and some local cafes and corner stores. You really can‚Äôt ask for anything more. Would definitely stay again.', 'A huge thank you to Laura for the beautiful week at her home in Brooklyn.
It is an ideal place to explore Manhattan and Brooklyn and then stroll around the corner in a very quiet, safe area of long days in the big city, the cafe around the corner, or at one of the restaurants.
The beautiful conversations with Laura, her hospitality and constant help are a big plus on top. I will definitely come back!', 'Had a wonderful stay in Laura‚Äôs lovely home. Cozy and beautiful bedroom and bath. Great communication and easy check in and out. Perfect location, close to everything. Would definitely stay again!', "Laura's place was close to the Q train; she was a kind and warm host throughout my stay. The room was comfortable, and the bathroom was very nice and clean. Overall, I really enjoyed staying there.", "Laura's house is great! Very quiet residential area within a 5mn walk of the Q line of the metro.
Laura is friendly and available to help us.
Go ahead", 'Laura is very kind, excellent host, very cozy house, very nice. Everything was excellent', 'Laura was very kind, I arrived quite late, but she stayed up and waited for me. The house itself is beautiful with an amazing wooden staircase and stained glass windows. My room was big, it has an armchair, perfect for drinking the morning coffee and an extremely comfortable bed. It was very quiet during the night, perfect for a good sleep. I shared the bathroom with the other guest on the same floor, but it was never a problem. Laura and her three daughters are very relaxed and nice people.
There are coffee shops nearby, I liked Lark the most. Prospect Park is a 15-minute walk away. I loved the beautiful subway station at Beverly road, getting to Union square took around 35 minutes (including the walk to the station) and the view from the Q train (it goes to Manhattan via Manhattan bridge) was amazing. Highly recommend!', "Being in Laura's happy home was a highlight of my recent stay in Brooklyn. Guest accommodations comfortable, clean, and private, while the kitchen and other living space is usually a social experience with Laura, her friends, and family. Great location, a truly a feel-good space to be in. I hope to return to Laura's from time to time.", 'Great stay in a wonderful neighborhood, with an exceptional host. This has our highest recommendation.', 'I loved my room and the house is a delight. Host Laura is very friendly and helpful. The neighborhood was great with easy access to subway. I would happily stay at Laura‚Äôs again.', 'A unique, great space and an oasis of calm', 'Laura was a wonderful host. She was friendly, offered helpful suggestions and made me feel at home. The guest room was spacious and comfortable and the shared bathroom was both roomy, well lit, and the shower was among the best ever!', "Laura was very welcoming and always cheerful and friendly. The bedroom was very comfortable with a walk-in closet, new plush carpeting, and a long, functional desk/drawers combination. The bathroom was exceptionally clean with a quaint claw tub and a large shower with 3 different showerheads: rain head, hand-held head, and 3 wall heads. The kitchen and a separate guest refrigerator were available, although I wasn't in need of it for this visit. The key-in entry allowed an easy access. The location was perfect for me as it was within walking distance to my destination. I would highly recommend a stay at Laura's, and hope it is available on my next visit.", 'Everything was perfect!', "la Laura's ideal house.
it is a little far from Manhattan but with the Q line, in 35-45 min you reach the most central areas of the city, and the stop is less than 5 minutes from the house.
the spacious and comfortable room.
we shared the bathroom with another room, but I never matched or uplifted to use the toilet or shower.
We didn't use the kitchen but we had it available.
the entrance to the house is very easy.
and of course Laura and her dog were very welcoming to us.
100% recommended.", 'Laura has a lovely house which was a perfect place to relax after a day of sightseeing. Really quiet and safe. Would recommended!', 'Laura was a wonderful host and was very welcoming and helpful!', "The house is gorgeous, the accommodation is big and roomy and extremely charming. Laura is a fantastic host with superb local knowledge and happy to chat, but also respects your space. I felt very safe and at home here. A great experience all round. The combination of Laura's friendly and professional hosting and the place itself make this a great option for all kinds of stays. Hope to come back soon!", "Laura's home is nearby Prospect Park, the Brooklyn Museum, and the Brooklyn Botanic Garden, and well connected to anywhere you would want to explore in NY (very close to the Q train). There's also some good dining options nearby on Cortelyou and also some delicious Caribbean food in Flatbush. It's very close to the Kings Theater if you are interested in seeing any shows there.
I loved the room and space. It felt so private, cozy, and peaceful. The room and bathroom have good natural light, and the bathroom was always spotless. Her home has good vibes and you can tell that a lot of thought went into everything (so many beautiful art pieces and details).
Laura is also very friendly, always open to having a nice chat, and welcoming.
I would love to stay here again and thank you to Laura and family for opening your home to us and for everything!", 'Loved put stay at Laura‚Äôs place! House is beautiful and well equipped. The location was great too, lots of good local spots and well connected with metro 5 mins walk from house. Thanks!', 'Very clean room, spacious closet and Laura was a wonderful host for my stay! I would recommend this listing to my friends if they are looking for a place to stay.', 'Laura is a wonderful wonderful host, the house is absolutely beautiful, room is spacious and clean, and my room get cleaned by the cleaning lady weekly.
The house is close to 2 stations and easy commute to Manhattan, Brooklyn is also fun to explored
Laura and her kids are super friendly and I was sick had headache, Laura also got me medicine
I had a wonderful wonderful time!', 'The room is spacious, the shower is great for tall people and it‚Äôs very quiet at night. The subway is 5 minutes from the house. I recommend strongly Laura‚Äôs house.', "Staying at Laura's for a week was really pleasant. She messaged me with the code to get into the house and there's another room key for the bedroom. The room is on the top floor, at the back of the house, and has a good window AC unit. It was in the 90s most of the week I was there, so I was super grateful for it. The room was very comfortable with the AC on (though loud). As everyone has pointed out, the bathroom was super nice, especially with the side jets. :) Good water pressure. There's some fridge space for each room, and although I didn't cook, it was always quiet in the mornings as I got breakfast ready. Unusually in NYC, there's also a front porch and backyard you can sit in. Laura was a helpful host and helped reset the power in my room (the lights went off at one point) and lent me an iron and ironing board. The location is good - the neighborhood can be loud but the house is quiet at night - and there's several subway stations and groceries within walking distance. I also worked remotely in my room for two days and the wifi was excellent. The only thing I wish the room had was better lighting (it's a little dim). Laura sells vintage items so the house is full of interesting art to look at. Overall a nice stay - thanks Laura!", 'Great place to stay. Getting in is easy. Subway is just a couple short blocks away. Neighborhood seems safe. The bed is comfy. The bathroom is large as is the tub and shower. 2 flights of stairs if you have issues with that.Laura is is nice and helpful', 'Very comfortable and pleasant stay. It felt like a home away from home, very cosy and spacious, with access to all the amenities you would have in your own home. Laura is a very friendly and approachable host, with lots of helpful advice and recommendations. The house manual provides a clear set of instructions, and there are lot of helpful labels in the house. The house is a beautiful old Victorian home, located in a lovely tree lined street, amongst other similar homes. Only a 5 minute walk away from two subway stations (at Beverley Road or Cortelyou Road) shops, cafes and restaurants. The Q train services both stations and links up to key locations in Manhattan, making it a convenient and cheap way to visit many tourist spots, both in Brooklyn and Manhattan. Happily recommend, and hope to re-visit in the future.', 'A very nice place, peaceful, beautiful, close of the subway. Laura is amazing and you will be comfortable to rest and clean yourself', 'Laura was an excellent host who made me feel right at home at her place in Brooklyn. Information provided ahead of time was super clear and thorough, and check-in was easy. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. The location is just a short walk away from two subway stations, plus several restaurants, cafes and grocery stores. Would definitely stay here again!', "There are two Airbnb bedrooms on the third floor of the large house, with a shared bathroom. I think there was somebody in the other bedroom the first night I was there, but I never saw them and the bathroom was completely clean and available whenever I needed it. The bedroom is clean and attractive and quiet. It's easy to get in and out of the house. If you need or want to stay in central Brooklyn, this offers excellent value. (And if you're walking toward Parkside, I highly recommend a new, tiny coffee shop on Caton, just the other side of Flatbush, called Mokafe To Go.)", 'Very good stay, Laura is very friendly. The room and bathroom are very clean', 'Laura was an excellent host and I really enjoyed staying at her place. She was away for the first few days of my stay but had left really clear instructions about everything and I didn‚Äôt need to contact her at all. The room was beautiful and really nice to come back to after a busy day in Manhattan. Everything was as advertised. Everything was easy to access in the area and there are plenty of shops and restaurants if you want to spend the evening in Brooklyn. As a solo female traveller I felt very safe in the area. I would definitely stay with Laura again if I return to New York.', 'Great and unique place to stay with a same host Laura. We felt like at home. Quiet residential area, short distance with shopping to the Q-Train or B-train. Looking forward to seeing you again.', 'The stay was great, definitely recommended!', "Such a cozy place to stay. The neighborhood is quiet, and close to 2 subway stations, which makes a huge difference when you visit NYC. Only 20 minutes walk to prospect park, very convenient if you are here RBC half marathon. I enjoy Laura's hospitality, and her art collection. I was amazed by all the art pieces she has in the house, it was as if you walked into a miniature art museum.", "Laura‚Äôs home is gorgeous, and the room was perfect. She took great care and it was a lovely place to stay for a few days in Brooklyn! Will definitely try to stay again whenever I'm back in the area :)", 'Laura‚Äôs beautiful home is very clean and looks exactly like the pictures. This was my second time staying at her Victorian home. It‚Äôs near to my daughters apartments in a quiet and pretty neighborhood where people are out walking their dogs at night, so it‚Äôs a safe place to be. Laura is friendly and the best hostess. We thoroughly enjoyed her and her place.', 'I‚Äôm a minimalist so my apartment was just great! I loved the spacious bathroom and it was clean. Way to go Laura!', 'Laura‚Äôs place is exactly like described.
It was comfortable, clean and hood location, in close proximity to subway Q.
Street parking is a bit tricky but manageable.
It is beautiful and safe neighbourhood.', 'Thank you Laura for hosting me. You and your family were wonderful and made me feel at home. I will definitely come back here.
Thank you again!', 'I highly recommend this AirBnB. The room is located in a beautiful, spacious home, on the top floor. The room is large, with a comfortable bed and significant space. The bathroom is shared with one other guest room, and is very clean and pleasant. The house is a 5 minute walk to the closest subway station, one block from a wealth of stores and restaurants, and a few blocks from Prospect Park. Guests may use the kitchen, which has everyone one might need, as well as the garden and living room. Laura is very friendly and helpful and easy to communicate with.', 'Laura is great and the house is beautiful. Would recommend to anyone.', 'Great spot in a charming Victorian right next to all the shopping on Cortelyou', 'This was my second time staying here, and I will come back whenever I can! Just what I needed in a perfect location, all for a great value! The house is beautiful and Laura is also super responsive.', 'Clean, cozy, quiet, comfortable, just like at home, hope to come again next time!', 'Our stay at Laura‚Äôs was wonderful and comfortable. Super easy access to the subway, the area felt friendly and Brooklyn is great!!
Laura gave recommendations and directions, she was super helpful.
We would love to stay again whenever we‚Äôre back in NYC.
So fun to stay in such a beautiful old style house in Brooklyn too.
Thank you for having us!!!', 'I always felt welcome and very comfortable with Laura:) Would go back anytime if I were to fly to New York.', 'Laura is a great fun host and was super flexible and supportive with everything. The place is just lovely as well. We explored basically all of NYC and some surrounding from there, which was super easy, given that it is only a 4 min walk from the Q subway line.', 'Laura was an excellent and friendly host and the property itself is quite charming. Hope to return here one day!', 'Great place to stay, with bags of character and good local amenities. Laura was most welcoming and helpful.', 'Beautiful victorian house in one of the unique and beautiful canopied streets in Brooklyn. The bed and bedding were great. Quiet facility. Excellent, clean and large shared bathroom. Laura has a bubbly and friendly personality.', "Great house in great location. Lovely host family, beautiful neighborhood. We'll be back!", 'The location was great, super close to the metro so getting to Manhattan was like an hour. The place itself is really cozy and feels like a home away from home. I‚Äôll def be coming back here next time I need a stay around nyc!', 'Really awesome place, very pretty and a great setup all around. It is a bit of a smaller shared space so you just need to be considerate, my neighbors very much were and it‚Äôs definitely set up to feel comfortable and private. The location is a bit less exciting, more on the outskirts of the city it felt like with a lot of chains rather than more interesting small shops you might come to nyc for and being just a bit more unkempt/empty. But it‚Äôs near a subway station so as long as you‚Äôre planning to travel around the city to your places that won‚Äôt be any problem. It‚Äôs a less expensive place so predictable differences like that are to be expected, but no unexpected problems existed that will make your stay uncomfortable. Professional and friendly host, pretty place, thoughtful people, private setup and all around comfortable great value stay.', 'Laura was extremely friendly, helpful and warm hostess. We enjoyed the stay and especially the long talks over morning coffee :)', 'Laura is so friendly to my brother and her room is bigger than expectation:)', 'Laura was very helpful and friendly and the room was clean, quiet, as described. It was just what I needed‚Ä¶a private escape from the city bustle. Laura was available for recommendations if needed, but also let me do my thing, which is usually what I do anyway. :-) I would absolutely stay again.', 'What a great find! We especially loved the beautiful tree-lined street and the convenient location‚Äîa short walk from the Q train, nearby shops and eateries on Cortelyou Rd., and a few blocks from Prospect Park. Room 5 was spacious and comfortable and Laura made us feel at home. Coming and going was a breeze with the keyless entry and we loved hanging out on the huge front porch in the evenings.', 'had a gorgeous stay at Laura‚Äôs! wasn‚Äôt in very much due to stacked days during my visit, but enjoyed my stay very much, she has a beautiful space. luckily got to meet her, and she gave a great rec closeby. plus, easiest check in!!', 'The room was fantastic. Comfy and clean with plenty of space to enjoy the temporary home away from home. There was even a clothes rack with hangers if I needed it. It was a nice surprise to see a room be a bit better than it looked in pictures for once.
While I did share the bathroom with another guest across the hall for part of it, I never ran into any conflicts. The shower is a fantastic waterfall style, with optional side jets you can turn on. It does take a bit of fidgeting with but once you figure it out it‚Äôs quick to warm up.
In what is a very busy city the room was very quiet. We did reach some warmer day temps while I was there but an open window helped cool down the room. I spotted some window air conditioners I suspect are in use in the summer.
It was great to chat with Laura when we crossed paths, with her years of experience in the city. Her dog, Ash, may bark at first but he seemed very quick to warm up to you once you were inside. I wish I actually took the time to try out the kitchen, as it looks like a cool stove to work with but maybe another time
The subway was a quick walk and about 40 minutes to most of the Manhattan destinations, but definitely be sure to check local transit notifications for reroutes. Definitely had to catch a further stop on the weekend because of maintenance but this seems to only be a couple months of the year (blame Metro on this one). Still was a quick walk either way.
Overall it was a great visit, I‚Äôd definitely look for her rooms next time I‚Äôm in town.', 'Great place to stay, clean! The communication with Laura was very easy. The neighborhood is cute and it‚Äôs nice to explore around the house.', 'Laura was friendly and welcoming. The room was super comfy and clean. Easy access to the Q train which passes a lovely view of the Brooklyn bridge if you‚Äôre heading to the city. Would definitely recommend staying here.', 'Great location and host for a local experience!!
The room was very spacious, clean, cute, and great.The conversation with her host is also a treasure trove of travel!
We were also given recommendations for laundry and places to eat!Above all, I appreciated the local information!
I want to stay longer next time!
I want to recommend it to everyone!
A great place and host for a great experience!!
The room was very spacious, clean and great. The conversation with the host was also a great memory!
I want to stay longer!
All in all, I recommend it!', 'It was a wonderful stay with Laura! a very short walking distance to the subway station. I felt like I was home, shower in the spotlessly clean restroom and sleep in the extremely comfortable bed after a day of walking in NYC, I felt so lucky to choose to stay with Laura! she is very helpful and kind, who gave me many tips of visiting the neighborhood and the city, made my life a lot easier. a big snowstorm on the day of my checkout, Laura was so kind to offer me to stay extra days with a little bit charge if my flight got canceled. I would definitely come back to Laura if I visit New York again.
Thank you Laura!', 'Great host', 'I really enjoyed staying at Laura‚Äôs. The neighborhood is great to explore and very close to Prospect Park with two metro stops close by. Laura and her family were very friendly!', 'Laura is very kind and lovely host! She answered always very quickly and check-in was very easy. Her house is very nice, we liked it very much amd enjoy our stay!', 'Great place, clean, very calm and quiet for NY. Nice host! Would recommend and come back here! Thanks to Laura for hosting us!', 'Excellent host, highly recommend', 'Excellent stay, would love to return. Laura is the consummate host and I felt very much at home. The neighborhood was nice and convenient to the subway. The place is comfortable and quiet. The other guestroom is on the other side of a hall and the shared bathroom. Laura was friendly and inviting. Everything was nice.', 'A perfect fit for us! My second visit with Laura who is a very personable host. The vintage Victorian home is very appealing if you care about those details. Shared well appointed bath, and kitchen avail for guest use are very accommodating. Also, very restful, this is a very quiet area at night!
The leafy family neighborhood, free street parking (admittedly, can be a challenge!), great food options on Cortelyou and nearby all make it especially nice to return to after a hectic day in Manhattan. Extra special is the Q line just two very short blocks away on Beverly Rd - 30 min to Midtown.', 'Highly recommend, fantastic place to stay!', "Exactly like the pictures. Room 5 was HUGE and comfortable. It was low to mid-90s while I was there and humid. It was so nice to come home at the end of the day and relax in that room with its great air conditioning. The bathroom was great and that shower was amazing. It was a nice residential neighborhood with restaurants and stores within walking distance. The only drawback was I had trouble navigating the stairs in the house. This isn't really anything negative about the house. But if you have mobility issues like I do (knee and foot injuries) just keep in mind you do have to go up to the third floor. The host was very open and welcoming. I would definitely recommend this, especially for women traveling alone. I felt very safe there.", "I highly recommend this AirBnB! The room is on the top floor of a large house, is spacious, lovingly furnished and very clean. The bathroom on the floor is shared with the other guest room.
I felt very comfortable and safe both in the house and in the neighborhood. The location of the house is perfect, two metro stations are close. The subway line is also very convenient as you can reach the most important places in Manhattan within 30 minutes.
Laura is a great host, she is always there for you if you have any questions or just want to have exciting conversations about life:)
As a solo tourist, I recommend this AirBnB, the amenities and opportunities to experience New York City comfortably and safely. I'd love to come back!", 'Thank you so much for this time! It is nice place for short weekends or for rent a long time. Beautiful house, very clean, subway 5 min. I love this placeü©∑']

title: Heart of Downtown NYC | Museums. Fitness Center
all_reviews: ['The staff was very attentive at the Moxy. The hotel is conveniently located near the Foulton station so it makes it easy to take the train to most parts of the city. There are various restaurants, bars, and attractions near the hotel as well that are walkable. Overall I would recommend staying here.', 'Great stay at Moxy Downtown NYC. The host was quick to communicate any time I had a question about our reservation. Would definitely stay here again.', 'I really enjoyed my stay, great experience at the moxy hotel. Also upbeat area with a-lot to do. Our host was very proactive and quick to respond. I recommend anyone to stay here.', 'Good location, nice rooms.', 'The moxy never disappoints', 'Great.']

title: Beautiful Zen Sanctuary - Middle of Manhattan
all_reviews:

Looking forward to returning every spring and fall.', 'Great little apartment in a great location. everything as described. already planning our trip back.', 'Awesome place', 'I had an amazing time! Location is amazing

Thanks for being such a great host!', 'Loved my stay! Location was top tier. Would definitely book again!', 'Great cozy apartment. James was very proactive and communications between us were fast and helpful. Also, he saved my glasses left behind! Would recommend to others.", 'Fabulous place, great location.
Your own patio in the middle of NYC!', 'Amazing place
Cozy.
Very relaxing
Will visit again', 'Great location with easy access to subway, Chelsea and The Village. Apartment is large, clean and comfortable. Decor and lighting are wonderful. Loved having the patio to unwind at the end of a long work day. Host was responsive and check-in was easy. The building itself is nothing special but has a secure, well lit entry and felt very safe.', 'It was a pleasure. The location of the apartment is perfect, you get everywhere in the city pretty fast. Ôøº
I can definitely recommend this place.', 'Everything was perfect. Loved walking the neighborhood‚Äîand Lyft or subway was at hand to get me to work/shows. Staying there was a real NY experience. Special treat is deck with covered lounge area and heat lamp. Great amenities all around.
Helpful Hint provided by James ‚ÄúTom": local groceries and other services deliver for a nominal fee+tip. It‚Äôs just like on TV!
Lots of great touches: cool lighting, huge TV with Apple TV attached with Netflix, Disney+ Amazon Prime and much more. Charging area next to couch with power strip. Coffee, spices and all sorts of condiments available -check before shopping. Union Square and Whole Foods 2 long blocks away, small gourmet market a block away. Walk south towards the Village for every type of restaurant you can imagine.
Loved this place. Will be back!', 'James was a very considerate host, easy to communicate with.', 'Great experience. 10/10 would stay again', 'A wonderful unique spot. Amazingly quiet and cozy. You will have good sleeps!']

title: Amazing room /beautiful new and comfortable home

["We stayed 6 nights at Odalis's place and everything went well. Odalis was very attentive and attentive despite the language barrier. Bus stop nearby so it's easy to get to downtown Manhattan. Great service for a great price.', 'Excellent accommodation, from cleanliness to location.
